segment.source: Windows Defender in Windows 10 (Windows 10)
segment.target: Windows Defender in Windows 10 (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic provides an overview of Windows Defender, including a list of system requirements and new features.
segment.target: This topic provides an overview of Windows Defender, including a list of system requirements and new features.

segment.source: Windows Defender in Windows 10
segment.target: Windows Defender in Windows 10

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Defender in Windows 10 is a built-in antimalware solution that provides security and antimalware management for desktops, portable computers, and servers.
segment.target: Windows Defender in Windows 10 is a built-in antimalware solution that provides security and antimalware management for desktops, portable computers, and servers.

segment.source: This topic provides an overview of Windows Defender, including a list of system requirements and new features.
segment.target: This topic provides an overview of Windows Defender, including a list of system requirements and new features.

segment.source: For more important information about running Windows Defender on a server platform, see Windows Defender Overview for Windows Server Technical Preview.
segment.target: For more important information about running Windows Defender on a server platform, see Windows Defender Overview for Windows Server Technical Preview.

segment.source: Take advantage of Windows Defender by configuring the settings and definitions using the following tools:
segment.target: Take advantage of Windows Defender by configuring the settings and definitions using the following tools:

segment.source: Microsoft Active Directory Group Policy for settings
segment.target: Microsoft Active Directory Group Policy for settings

segment.source: Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) for definitions
segment.target: Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) for definitions

segment.source: Windows Defender provides the most protection when cloud-based protection is enabled.
segment.target: Windows Defender provides the most protection when cloud-based protection is enabled.

segment.source: Learn how to enable cloud-based protection in Configure Windows Defender in Windows 10.
segment.target: Learn how to enable cloud-based protection in Configure Windows Defender in Windows 10.

segment.source: Note: System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1, System Center 2012 Configuration Manager SP2, and Microsoft Intune can provide centralized management of Windows Defender, including:
segment.target: Note: System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager SP1, System Center 2012 Configuration Manager SP2, and Microsoft Intune can provide centralized management of Windows Defender, including:

segment.source: Settings management
segment.target: Settings management

segment.source: Definition update management
segment.target: Definition update management

segment.source: Alerts and alert management
segment.target: Alerts and alert management

segment.source: Reports and report management
segment.target: Reports and report management

segment.source: When you enable endpoint protection for your clients, it will install an additional management layer on Windows Defender to manage the in-box Windows Defender agent.
segment.target: When you enable endpoint protection for your clients, it will install an additional management layer on Windows Defender to manage the in-box Windows Defender agent.

segment.source: While the client user interface will still appear as Windows Defender, the management layer for Endpoint Protection will be listed in the Add/Remove Programs control panel, though it will appear as if the full product is installed.
segment.target: While the client user interface will still appear as Windows Defender, the management layer for Endpoint Protection will be listed in the Add/Remove Programs control panel, though it will appear as if the full product is installed.

segment.source: Minimum system requirements
segment.target: Minimum system requirements

segment.source: Windows Defender has the same hardware requirements as Windows 10.
segment.target: Windows Defender has the same hardware requirements as Windows 10.

segment.source: For more information, see:
segment.target: For more information, see:

segment.source: Minimum hardware requirements
segment.target: Minimum hardware requirements

segment.source: Hardware component guidelines
segment.target: Hardware component guidelines

segment.source: New and changed functionality
segment.target: New and changed functionality

segment.source: Improved detection for unwanted applications and emerging threats using cloud-based protection.
segment.target: Improved detection for unwanted applications and emerging threats using cloud-based protection.

segment.source: Use the Microsoft Active Protection Service to improve protection against unwanted applications and advanced persistent threats in your enterprise.
segment.target: Use the Microsoft Active Protection Service to improve protection against unwanted applications and advanced persistent threats in your enterprise.

segment.source: Windows 10 integration.
segment.target: Windows 10 integration.

segment.source: All Windows Defender in Windows 10 endpoints will show the Windows Defender user interface, even when the endpoint is managed.
segment.target: All Windows Defender in Windows 10 endpoints will show the Windows Defender user interface, even when the endpoint is managed.

segment.source: Operating system, enterprise-level management, and bring your own device (BYOD) integration.
segment.target: Operating system, enterprise-level management, and bring your own device (BYOD) integration.

segment.source: Windows 10 introduces a mobile device management (MDM) interface for devices running Windows 10.
segment.target: Windows 10 introduces a mobile device management (MDM) interface for devices running Windows 10.

segment.source: Administrators can use MDM-capable products, such as Intune, to manage Windows Defender on Windows 10 devices.
segment.target: Administrators can use MDM-capable products, such as Intune, to manage Windows Defender on Windows 10 devices.

segment.source: For more information about what's new in Windows Defender in Windows 10, see Windows Defender in Windows 10: System integration on the Microsoft Active Protection Service website.
segment.target: For more information about what's new in Windows Defender in Windows 10, see Windows Defender in Windows 10: System integration on the Microsoft Active Protection Service website.

segment.source: Update and manage Windows Defender in Windows 10
segment.target: Update and manage Windows Defender in Windows 10

segment.source: IT professionals can manage Windows Defender on Windows 10 endpoints in their organization using Active Directory or WSUS, apply updates to endpoints, and manage scans using:
segment.target: IT professionals can manage Windows Defender on Windows 10 endpoints in their organization using Active Directory or WSUS, apply updates to endpoints, and manage scans using:

segment.target: Group Policy Settings

segment.source: Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI)
segment.target: Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI)

segment.target: PowerShell

segment.source: Configure Windows Defender in Windows 10
segment.target: Configure Windows Defender in Windows 10

segment.source: IT professionals can configure definition updates and cloud-based protection in Windows Defender in Windows 10 through Active Directory and WSUS.
segment.target: IT professionals can configure definition updates and cloud-based protection in Windows Defender in Windows 10 through Active Directory and WSUS.

segment.source: Troubleshoot Windows Defender in Windows 10
segment.target: Troubleshoot Windows Defender in Windows 10

segment.source: IT professionals can review information about event IDs in Windows Defender for Windows 10 and see any relevant action they can take.
segment.target: IT professionals can review information about event IDs in Windows Defender for Windows 10 and see any relevant action they can take.
